0.9.0.name: vega-lite

author.name: Jeffrey Heer, Dominik Moritz, Kanit "Ham" Wongsuphasawat

0.9.0.description: Vega-lite provides a higher-level grammar for visual analysis, comparable to ggplot or Tableau, that generates complete Vega specifications.

scripts.build: browserify src/vl.ts -p tsify -d -s vl | exorcist vega-lite.js.map > vega-lite.js
scripts.postbuild: uglifyjs vega-lite.js -cm --source-map vega-lite.min.js.map > vega-lite.min.js && npm run schema
scripts.cover: tsc && istanbul cover node_modules/.bin/_mocha -- --recursive
scripts.clean: rm -f vega-lite.* vega-lite-schema.json & find src -name '*.js*' -type f -delete & find test -name '*.js*' -type f -delete
scripts.deploy: npm run clean && npm run lint && npm run test && scripts/deploy.sh
scripts.schema: tsc && node src/schema/schemagen.js > vega-lite-schema.json
scripts.test: tsc && mocha --recursive --require source-map-support/register
scripts.watch:build: watchify src/vl.ts -p tsify -v -d -s vl -o 'exorcist vega-lite.js.map > vega-lite.js'
scripts.watch:dev: nodemon -e ts -x 'npm test && npm run lint'
scripts.watch:all: nodemon -e ts -x 'npm test && npm run lint && npm run build'

1.0.0.name: vega-lite

author.name: Jeffrey Heer, Dominik Moritz, Kanit "Ham" Wongsuphasawat

1.0.0.description: Vega-lite provides a higher-level grammar for visual analysis, comparable to ggplot or Tableau, that generates complete Vega specifications.

scripts.postbuild: uglifyjs vega-lite.js -cm --source-map vega-lite.min.js.map > vega-lite.min.js && npm run schema
scripts.build:all: npm run clean && npm run build && npm test && npm run lint && npm run images
scripts.cover: tsc && istanbul cover node_modules/.bin/_mocha -- --recursive
scripts.clean: rm -f vega-lite.* vega-lite-schema.json & find src -name '*.js*' -type f -delete & find test -name '*.js*' -type f -delete & find site -name '*.js*' -type f -delete & rm -rf examples/_diff examples/_original examples/_output examples/images
scripts.lint: tslint -c tslint.json src/*.ts test/*.ts src/**/*.ts test/**/*.ts
scripts.prestart: node scripts/index-examples
scripts.schema: typescript-json-schema --required true src/schema/schema.ts Spec > vega-lite-schema.json
scripts.presite: tsc && npm run build && bower install
scripts.test: tsc && npm run schema && mocha --recursive --require source-map-support/register test examples
scripts.watch:build: watchify src/vl.ts -p tsify -v -d -s vl -o 'exorcist vega-lite.js.map > vega-lite.js'
scripts.watch: nodemon -x 'npm run build && npm test && npm run lint'

2.0.0-rc4.description: Vega-lite provides a higher-level grammar for visual analysis, comparable to ggplot or Tableau, that generates complete Vega specifications.

scripts.pretsc: mkdir -p build && rm -rf build/*/** && cp package.json build/
scripts.build:only: npm run tsc && cp package.json build && browserify src/index.ts -p tsify -d -s vl | exorcist build/vega-lite.js.map > build/vega-lite.js
scripts.postbuild: node node_modules/uglify-js/bin/uglifyjs build/vega-lite.js -cm --source-map content=build/vega-lite.js.map,filename=build/vega-lite.min.js.map -o build/vega-lite.min.js && npm run schema
scripts.build:examples: npm run data && npm run build:only && npm run build:examples-only
scripts.build:site: browserify site/static/main.ts -p [tsify -p site] -d | exorcist build/site/main.js.map > build/site/main.js
scripts.clean: rm -rf build && rm -f vega-lite.* & find -E src test site examples -regex '.*\.(js|js.map|d.ts)' -delete
scripts.prestart: npm run data && npm run build && scripts/index-examples
scripts.schema: ts-json-schema-generator --path tsconfig.json --type TopLevelExtendedSpec > build/vega-lite-schema.json && npm run renameschema && cp build/vega-lite-schema.json _data/
scripts.presite: npm run build && npm run data && npm run build:site && npm run build:toc && npm run build:versions
scripts.test: npm run build:only && npm run test:only && npm run test:runtime && npm run lint
scripts.posttest: npm run schema && npm run data && npm run mocha:examples
scripts.test:nocompile: npm run test:only && npm run test:runtime && npm run lint && npm run mocha:examples
scripts.test:runtime:generate: rm -Rf test-runtime/resources && VL_GENERATE_TESTS=true npm run test:runtime
scripts.test:debug: npm run tsc && mocha --recursive --debug-brk --inspect build/test
scripts.test:debug-examples: npm run tsc && npm run schema && mocha --recursive --debug-brk --inspect build/examples
scripts.watch:build: watchify src/index.ts -p tsify -v -d -s vl -o 'exorcist build/vega-lite.js.map > build/vega-lite.js'
scripts.watch: nodemon -x 'npm run build && npm run test:nocompile' # already ran schema in build

readme:
# [Vega-Lite](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/) 2 Release Candidate

**Announcement:** The `master` branch now hosts ongoing Vega-Lite 2.0 *pre-release* development.
We have migrated Vega-Lite to use the new Vega 3 Beta and D3 v4 and include basic composition and interaction features from [our research publication](http://idl.cs.washington.edu/papers/vega-lite).  However, some composition and interaction features are still under development.

For a more stable version, please use Vega-Lite v1. We have created branch [`1.x`](https://github.com/vega/vega-lite/tree/1.x) as our v1 maintenance branch.

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/vega/vega-lite.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/vega/vega-lite)
[![npm dependencies](https://david-dm.org/vega/vega-lite.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/vega-lite)
[![npm version](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/vega-lite.svg)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/vega-lite)

![Teaser](site/static/teaser.png)

Vega-Lite provides a higher-level grammar for visual analysis, akin to ggplot or Tableau, that generates complete [Vega](https://vega.github.io/) specifications.

You can find more details, [documentation](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/docs/), [examples](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/examples/), [usage instructions](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/usage/embed.html), and [tutorials](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/tutorials/getting_started.html) on the [Vega-Lite website](https://vega.github.io/vega-lite/).

Try using Vega-Lite in the online [Vega Editor](https://vega.github.io/editor/#/custom/vega-lite).

Contributions are also welcome. Please see [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for contribution and development guidelines and our [Code of Conduct](https://vega.github.io/vega/about/code-of-conduct/).

## Team

The development of Vega-Lite is led by [Kanit "Ham" Wongsuphasawat](https://twitter.com/kanitw), [Dominik Moritz](https://twitter.com/domoritz), [Arvind Satyanarayan](https://twitter.com/arvindsatya1), and [Jeffrey Heer](https://twitter.com/jeffrey_heer) of the [University Washington Interactive Data Lab](https://idl.cs.washington.edu).
Please see the [contributors page](https://github.com/vega/vega-lite/graphs/contributors) for the full list of contributors.

author.name: Jeffrey Heer, Dominik Moritz, Kanit "Ham" Wongsuphasawat
